content: - exit thunderbird on new pc - copy the thunderbird folder from the ....appdata\roaming\ folder from old PC and paste into c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the exiting thunderbird folder. - restart thunerbird
creator: davidsk

content:
Probabilmente è lo stesso problema discusso qui -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/questions/1442152

per cui valgono le stesse considerazioni:

Il tuo IP è inserito in una lista di spammer, per cui le tue email vengono bloccate. Se il tuo operatore lo permette, prova a cambiare IP Altrimenti contatta Tiscali perché ti sblocchino. Thuderbird c'entra nulla in questo caso. Ti mostra solo la risposta che ottiene quando contatta il tuo server di posta.
creator: @next

content: My experience is the same as yours. My understanding is that the 'send to' feature is primarily for sending email addresses to Thunderbird, not attachments. Others on the forum may have more information.
creator: davidsk

content: Are you wanting the attachment to be included on replies? It is not clear. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content: I receive an e-mail with an attachment from person A. If a third person C replies to person A (and all other cc participants), the first original email with attachement is no longer in my Thunderbird mailbox as an original, but is in the history of person C's reply, but without an attachment. I want the original to be retained, as was customary in the past (and also today with outlook) (then I keep the attachment).
creator: koenig.sel

content: Please check if your inbox is threaded. If so, see if the problem is corrected with unthreaded.
creator: davidsk

content: Thank you for the quick reply. I do not understand the term "threaded" and cannot find a function in the inbox server that I can assign to the term. May be, that this is a Problem of translation?!
creator: koenig.sel

content: highlight the inbox, select view>sort by and see if 'unthreaded' is ticked. If menu bar is not visible, click alt key first to display 'View' in menu.
